comments.species:
Support info: "Wild-Type Primary **Mouse** Neuronal Cultures. Animal protocols used in this study, as well as the overall **mouse** husbandry practices,"

13/2/2017 Pim
-"We imaged the distribution of the **endogenous** SNARE proteins SNAP-25 and syntaxin-1 in cultured neurons by direct immunofluorescence (Figs. 2 and 3)"
comments.rationale:
improved two-color fluorescence nanoscopy showed nanoscale clusters consisting of syntaxin-1 and SNAP-25 that contained associated Munc18-1 at presynaptic plasmamembrane

8/12/2016 Pim
- Cortical neurons were used (Suppl info: " **Cortices** from newborn mouse pups were dissected in ice-cold Hank’s Balanced Salt Solution ")

general.text:
8/12/2016 Pim
- This sentence ("... localizations show that upon deletion of both syntaxin-1 isoforms, SNAP-25 remains localized on the membrane whereas Munc18-1 is mostly distributed in the cytoplasm....") in the text from Fig.4 suggest to me that "presynaptic cytosol" is not the correct term. Can you explain your choice?
- Added "cerebral cortex" to "Additional information" fields
You are right, my bad: presynaptic membrane of course

Allright. One other matter. SNAP25 has a S-palmitoyl moiety that originally was thought to mediate the interaction of SNAP-25 with membranes, but when tested appeared not to do so (see PMID: 10644766). I have proposed to make the term 'extrinsic component of presynaptic membrane' (a.k.a. 'connected to membrane via interaction with other protein') to reflect this. I have also added this ref to the 'additional literature'. When you agree with this change I finalize this ticket.

Changes by checker: 
- Changed 'presynaptic membrane (GO:0042734)' to 'extrinsic component of presynaptic membrane (GO:0098888)' in field goTerm
- Changed 'Support info: "Wild-Type Primary **Mouse** Neuronal Cultures. Animal protocols used in this study, as well as the overall **mouse** husbandry practices,"' to 'Support info: "Wild-Type Primary **Mouse** Neuronal Cultures. Animal protocols used in this study, as well as the overall **mouse** husbandry practices," 13/2/2017 Pim -"We imaged the distribution of the **endogenous** SNARE proteins SNAP-25 and syntaxin-1 in cultured neurons by direct immunofluorescence (Figs. 2 and 3)"' in field speciesRationale
- Added supporting literature, PMID:10644766
agree
Ok, closing!

comments.species: Hippocampal CA3–CA1 regions were dissected from 1- to 2-d-old Sprague Dawley rats, dissociated, and plated onto poly-ornithine-coated glass for 14–21 d as described previously (Ryan, 1999).
comments.rationale:
Combination of knock down and pharmacological inhibitions along with function measures of presynaptic calcium influx shows that CDK5 normally constrains the activity of voltage-gated Ca channels.

23/01/2017 Pim
- Fig.1 KD of CNa has negative effect on SV exocytosis
- Fig.2 KD/agonist of CDK5 has positive effect on SV exocytosis
- Fig.2 Effect of CDK5 and CNa is via VGCCs (shown via VGCC inhibition)
- Fig.3/4/5/6 CNa and CDK5 activities affect presynaptic Ca influx

general.text: Great annotation! I have selected the "regulation of ..." box since CDK5 regulates the activity of the Ca-channel via phosphorylation.

Question:
Would it also be correct to make the same annotation for  calcineurin A??

Hi - I plan to put a separate entry for Calcineurins - there are 5 related genes in total (2 regulatory, 3 catalytic). Calcineurin A generally refers to the catalyic subunits. I agree with your regulation selection
Ok, finalizing this ticket based on feedback.

comments.species:
Legend to Figure 2 "Enrichment profiles of Rab GTPases on purified SVs isolated from rat brain homogenates, determined by quantitative immunoblotting"

Species of OE Rab11B in Fig 3 is human. Other figures show localization of rat protein. Annotation accepted against rat species.
comments.rationale: RAB11B was detected on highly purified synaptic vesicles using mass spectrometric and immunoblot analyses. GFP-RAB11B colocalises well with synaptophysin puncta in transiently transfected cultured hippocampal neurons.

general.text:
Implementation note:
- 'cerebrum' relates to the Biochem. studies.
- 'hippocampus' related to the microscopy studies.

comments.species: Primary hippocampal neuronal cultures were prepared from newborn pups of RIM1αβf/f, RIM2αβγf/f, or RIM1αβf/f/RIM2αβγf/f mice according to standard protocols (4, 21).
comments.rationale: RIM2 knockout cultures have a reduction in the size of the sucrose pool at inhibitory synapses, demonstrating a role for RIM2 in vesicle priming.  Due to the strong homology between RIM1 and RIM2, both proteins are assumed to be redundant in this process. Action potential mediated pool measurements have confirmed a role in priming for RIM1 and RIM2 at the Calyx of Held (Han et.al. 2011).

general.text:
Finalized!

changes by checker: 
- added 'IGI: Q99NE5 (mouse RIM1)' to field implementationComments

comments.species: Fig2: sec5E10 larvae, between 72 and 96 hr AEL have no detectable Sec5 protein
comments.rationale:
Fig 3: Loss of Sec5 Prevents Growth of the Neuromuscular Junction
Fig 4: Sec5 Is Required for Neurite Outgrowth
Fig 5: Transport of an Integral Membrane Protein (CD8) to the Cell Surface Is Impaired in sec5 Mutants, not intracellular trafficking
Fig 6: Sec5 was not required for axonal transport of the CD8-containing vesicles but null mutant show strongly reduced surface expression of CD8 and Synaptotagmin-GFP (Fig 7).
Fig 8: Synaptic Transmission Persists in sec5 Null Mutants
Hence, trafficking for cell growth and membrane protein insertion depend on sec5, whereas transmitter secretion does not

13/2/2017 Pim:
-Reading the abstract, the authors suggest that Sec5 is mediating membrane transport/insertion associated with synapse maturation (especially expansion of NMJ). 
-From this scentence (Fig.3): "However, sec5E10 mutant larvae do not grow substantially between 48 and 96 hr AEL. Because maternal protein decreases dramatically during larval development in the mutant, we looked for any aberrations in the postembryonic maturation of the NMJ." --> 'synapse maturation'
-From Fig.5+6+7: Sec5 mediates vesicular axonal transport of TM proteins --> "[GO:0099641] anterograde axonal protein transport"

general.text: Difficult to pick GO term: it is not axonal trafficking, also not SV fusion but fusion of vesicles essential for neurite growth and synapse formation. please advice

Reading the abstract, the authors suggest that Sec5 is mediating membrane transport/insertion associated with synapse maturation (especially expansion of NMJ). 

From this scentence (Fig.3): "However, sec5E10 mutant larvae do not grow substantially between 48 and 96 hr AEL. Because maternal protein decreases dramatically during larval development in the mutant, we looked for any aberrations in the postembryonic maturation of the NMJ." --> 'synapse maturation'

From Fig.5+6+7: Sec5 mediates vesicular axonal transport of TM proteins --> "[GO:0099641] anterograde axonal protein transport"

The final implementation will look equivalent to "anterograde axonal protein transport regulating synapse maturation results_in_morphogenesis_of NMJ"

If you agree with this solution I finalize this ticket...

changes by checker: 
- added 'Q9VQQ9' to field uniprot 
- changed '** cannot find term **' to 'synapse maturation (GO:0060074)' in field goTerm
agree!
Ok closing!

comments.species: HeLa cells were cultured in Dulbecco’s-modified Eagle’s Medium. p. 551
comments.rationale:
The primary PMID shows regulation of human PMCA1 activity, the inference shows the occurence of PMCA1 at presynaptic active zone by proteomics.

26/01/2017 Pim
Inference:
18029012 Fig.6: shows IDA of "regulation of cytosolic calcium levels" of human AT2B1
SynGO ID#89: shows localization of rat AT2B1 in the AZ membrane of GABA and Glutamate synapses.
known info: AT2B1 is a ATP-fueled calcium pump.

general.text: Synapse types are infered from SynGO ID 89.

comments.species: In Fig2 legend: "Lowicryl postembedding electron microscopy was applied to localize PNKD in the neocortex of wild-type and Pnkd−/− mice."
comments.rationale: immuno-EM study on this protein shows cytosolic localisation of protein. Null mutant mice are using as (strong) control for non-specific reactivity.

comments.species: "Low-density microisland cultures of hippocampal pyramidal neurons were prepared from E15–E17 wild-type, rab3A-mutant and synaptotagmin I mutant mouse embryos as described."
comments.rationale:
Increased average peak quantal release per synapse in rab3a KO neurons treated with either MK-801 or AP5 and enhanced paired-pulse facilitation in these neurons indicate a higher quantal release per synapse (i.e. more synaptic vesicles fuse per synapse) during stimulation.

19/01/2017 Pim
This annotation build s on well established information that rab3a is a protein attached to the SV membrane.

general.text:
-Added "hippocampus" to synapse type information
-added info to description

comments.species: Electron micrographs of ultrathin sections of rat brain (A–C) and agarose-embedded synaptosomal preparations (D–F) are shown. p. 506
comments.rationale: EM localization after peroxidase reaction at the active zone of A) mossy fibre terminals in the CA3, B) active zone of the shaft synapse in CA3, C) immunoreactivity in shaft synapse of the molecular layer of CA3, D,E) ultrastructural localization of Bassoon in isolated nerve terminals by immunogold EM.

general.text: First clear localization of Bassoon specifically at the active zone as a component of the cytomatrix of the active zone.
Just to make sure. Uniprot mentions that Bassoon has a lipid anchor (on rat BSN Glycine 2). Is BSN a membrane anchored protein?

We know that Bsn may be myristoylated, however, we never could find a function for this and we do not know if it is indeed anchored to synaptic plasma membrane or synaptic vesicles. Please, check Dresbach et al., 2003 PMID 12812759.
Ok, I will leave the term as is and not change into the "anchored component of AZ membrane".

comments.species: our wild-type eight-week-old male C57BL/6N mice were perfused transcardially with 4% paraformaldehyde/0.1 M sodium phosphate buffer (PB, pH 7.2) for light microscopic immuno- histochemistry or with 4% paraformaldehyde/0.1% glutaraldehyde/ 0.1 M PB for immunoelectron microscopy.
comments.rationale: Quantitative immunogold reactivity against SNX1 in mouse hippocampal pyramidal neurons shows a predominant postsynaptic distribution. SNX1 is localized to endosome membranes, but the subclass of endosome (early/late/recycling) is not unambiguously determined

general.text:
Great first annotation! Keep up this quality.
